verses.text_plain: Therefore doth Job open his mouth in vain; he multiplieth words without knowledge.
verses.verse_html: 16Therefore doth Job open his mouth in vain; he multiplieth words without knowledge.

tokens.definition: אִיּוֹב ʼÎyôwb, ee-yobe'; from H340 ; hated (i.e. persecuted); Ijob, the patriarch famous for his patience:—Job.
tokens.kjv_translation_count: Job (58x).
outline: Job = "hated" a patriarch, the subject of the book of Job
a patriarch, the subject of the book of Job

tokens.definition: פָּצָה pâtsâh, paw-tsaw'; a primitive root; to rend, i.e. open (especially the mouth):—deliver, gape, open, rid, utter.
tokens.kjv_translation_count: open (10x), rid (2x), gaped (1x), utter (1x), deliver (1x).
outline: to part, open, separate, set free (Qal) to open (mouth), utter to snatch away, set free

tokens.definition: פֶּה peh, peh; from H6284 ; the mouth (as the means of blowing), whether literal or figurative (particularly speech); specifically edge, portion or side; adverbially (with preposition) according to:—accord(-ing as, -ing to), after, appointment, assent, collar, command(-ment), × eat, edge, end, entry, file, hole, × in, mind, mouth, part, portion, × (should) say(-ing), sentence, skirt, sound, speech, × spoken, talk, tenor, × to, two-edged, wish, word.

outline: (peh) mouth mouth (of man) mouth (as organ of speech) mouth (of animals) mouth, opening, orifice (of a well, river, etc) extremity, end
mouth, opening, orifice (of a well, river, etc)

tokens.definition: הֶבֶל hebel, heh'bel; or (rarely in the abs.) הֲבֵל hăbêl; from H1891 ; emptiness or vanity; figuratively, something transitory and unsatisfactory; often used as an adverb:— × altogether, vain, vanity.
tokens.kjv_translation_count: vanity (61x), vain (11x), altogether (1x).
outline: vapour, breath breath, vapour vanity (fig.) adverb

tokens.definition: כָּבַר kâbar, kaw-bar'; a primitive root; properly, to plait together, i.e. (figuratively) to augment (especially in number or quantity, to accumulate):—in abundance, multiply.
tokens.kjv_translation_count: multiply (1x).
outline: to be much, be many, be in abundance, intertwine, multiply (Hiphil) to make many, make great

tokens.definition: מִלָּה millâh, mil-law'; from H4448 (plural masculine as if from מִלֶּה milleh; a word; collectively, a discourse; figuratively, a topic:— answer, by-word, matter, any thing (what) to say, to speak(-ing), speak, talking, word.
tokens.kjv_translation_count: word (23x), speech (6x), say (2x), speaking (2x), answer (with H 7725) (1x), byword (1x), matter (1x), speak (1x), talking (1x).

tokens.definition: בְּלִי bᵉlîy, bel-ee'; from H1086 ; properly, failure, i.e. nothing or destruction; usually (with preposition) without, not yet, because not, as long as, etc.:—corruption, ig(norantly), for lack of, where no...is, so that no, none, not, un(awares), without.

tokens.definition: דַּעַת daʻath, dah'-ath; from H3045 ; knowledge:—cunning, (ig-) norantly, know(-ledge), (un-) awares (wittingly).
